metadata.synopsis: The Druid Grove has been saved (because either the attacking force was repelled or its leaders were assassinated) and Halsin returns. He thanks the player and reacts to events that may have transpired in the grove during his absence. He's previously promised to help the player with their tadpole problem, but he defers this discussion until the next morning after the victory celebrations.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Blow the horn and side with the tieflings (kill all goblin).5. goto 260.71, 14.82, 523.326. Talk with Halsin.7. Skip through the dialog with Kagha.8. Talk with Halsin again.or1. Start the game2. oe readygoblinhuntvictory3.  goto 207; 4654. Talk to Zevlor, skip the dialogue but he needs to stay.5. goto 259; 5206. Talk to Halsin and skip the dialogue.7. Talk to Halsin again.

8.speaker: Halsin
8.text: Your path will soon take you away from the grove, I feel. Your efforts will not be forgotten.
8.context: NodeContext: Content and grateful. Looks around at his surrounds in general, happy to be home,

15.speaker: Halsin
15.text: With the leadership dead, no attack will be mounted on the grove. I am in your debt, my friend.
15.context: NodeContext: Content and grateful. Looks around at his surrounds in general, happy to be home,

28.speaker: Halsin
28.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. And again, I am in your debt.
28.context: NodeContext: Content and grateful. Looks around at his surrounds in general, happy to be home,

38.speaker: Halsin
38.text: Speak to Rath - he will reward you for your efforts.
38.context: NodeContext: Referring to one of his underlings

4.speaker: Player
4.text: What about my problem? I need to get to Moonrise Towers.

64.speaker: Halsin
64.text: Soon. Remember the dangers I told you about - there'll be plenty of time to face them.

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: Take tonight to rest, recuperate - celebrate. Tomorrow, we can strike out.

17.speaker: Halsin
17.text: Take tonight to rest, recuperate - celebrate. Tomorrow, I'll join your camp so I can help with the trials yet to come.

9.speaker: Halsin
9.text: Soon. First I must set matters to rights in the grove. And you should celebrate your victory.

25.speaker: Halsin
25.text: After being dormant for so long, your infection is unlikely to produce new symptoms spontaneously.

55.speaker: Halsin
55.text: Tomorrow morning, we shall discuss what is to come.
55.context: NodeContext: This is a much anticipated converation that he's aluding to.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: No more delays. Tell me what you know about getting to Moonrise.
65.context: NodeContext: Bowed head. Mournful, Kagha was misguided, but he'll miss her.,

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I'm afraid your pupil, Kagha, is dead.
7.context: NodeContext: Bowed head. Mournful, Kagha was misguided, but he'll miss her.,

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Kagha is dead. She was swayed by Shadow Druids. I had no choice.
67.context: NodeContext: Bowed head. Mournful, Kagha was misguided, but he'll miss her.,

27.speaker: Halsin
27.text: Kagha... poor child. The grove will be a dimmer place without her potential.
27.context: NodeContext: Bowed head. Mournful, Kagha was misguided, but he'll miss her.,

41.speaker: Halsin
41.text: But you are right - you had no choice. I failed her, long before you arrived.
41.context: NodeContext: He doesn't blame the player

5.speaker: Halsin
5.text: The shadows could not have tempted her if I had taught her as I should have.

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: But the grove still stands even if she does not - thanks to you.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: The other druids are dead. They turned on us - we had to defend ourselves.
14.context: NodeContext: Mournful, bowed head. He blames himself rather than the player.

58.speaker: Halsin
58.text: Yes, you did. You acted according to your instincts, to nature. This is my fault.
58.context: NodeContext: Mournful, bowed head. He blames himself rather than the player.

39.speaker: Halsin
39.text: I was not here to guide them. Now they rest forever, while I carry the weight of my failings.

34.speaker: Halsin
34.text: But the grove still stands even if they do not - thanks to you.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I hope this grove of yours is worth the bloodshed.
37.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I found evidence that Kagha was going to betray this circle to the Shadow Druids.
22.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

45.speaker: Halsin
45.text: This goes some way to explaining her actions. But she has been punished already, and the Shadow Druids have no power over her now - time to let the wound heal.

57.speaker: Halsin
57.text: And thank you, for your dilligence.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I found this letter that shows Kagha was working with the Shadow Druids.
24.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I hope this grove of yours was worth the bloodshed.
44.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

61.speaker: Halsin
61.text: Believe me, it is. The span of a mortal life isn't enough to grasp the importance of this place. Its roots touch everything.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: There's something else I wanted to ask about getting to Moonrise Towers.
20.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

18.speaker: Player
18.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

36.speaker: Halsin
36.text: The journey to Moonrise Towers, and all the dangers that that entails.
36.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

63.speaker: Halsin
63.text: But that's tomorrow's problem. Take some time for yourself tonight - rest, celebrate. Come morning, I'll be by your side.

12.speaker: Halsin
12.text: Rest. Heal. Celebrate if you wish. Mourn if you must. Come morning, we shall discuss delivering you from your parasite.
12.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

48.speaker: Halsin
48.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. I owe you my thanks - and an introduction.
48.context: NodeContext: Grateful. this is the first time Halsin has met you (if you missed him in the goblin camp)

2.speaker: Halsin
2.text: I am Halsin - First Druid of the Emerald Grove... and I sense you have a problem you seek my help with.
2.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I might go mad... I might be mad...
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

21.speaker: Halsin
21.text: Oakfather... a mind flayer spawn. You should be far gone by now.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Yes. I have a mind flayer parasite inside my head. I want your help removing it.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I don't know what you mean. What problem?
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: ...That problem. You're infected with the mind flayer spawn, aren't you? Oakfather preserve you, child.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

56.speaker: Halsin
56.text: ...That problem. You're infected with the mind flayer spawn, aren't you? Oakfather preserve you, child.

3.speaker: Halsin
3.text: ...It's true. I can feel it right now. Oakfather preserve you, child.

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: But... something's different. You're aware of the monster inside you. You don't bow to the Absolute, like the True Souls do...

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I can't remember anything... All my life before the parasite...

59.speaker: Halsin
59.text: It sounds as if you've been done a world of harm. Cling onto the life you yet have.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I escaped from an illithid ship after being infected. Maybe the process was interrupted.

23.speaker: Halsin
23.text: Perhaps... but I wouldn't want to place all my faith in blind luck.

30.speaker: Halsin
30.text: It's no coincidence that we found each other, I'll wager? You're after a cure for this parasite.

43.speaker: Halsin
43.text: There's a chokehold of magic, binding the creature to you. Any efforts to remove it would almost certainly kill you - or worse.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: As for what you've done for the grove, speak to Rath. He will see to your reward.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Wait - how did you get here?

31.speaker: Halsin
31.text: I was an unwilling guest of the goblins - but your efforts left them in disarray and I was able to escape.

50.speaker: Halsin
50.text: Enjoy the respite. Come morning, we have matters to discuss.
